metadata.title: Measurement conditions for flash memory Programming time, Erasure time, and Blank check time

sections.content:
Question:
Software processing is required when writing to flash memory, but under what conditions are the Programming time, Erasure time, and Blank check time listed in the electrical characteristics of the manual measured?
Answer:
[Products that use the FACI command to control flash memory]
Processing begins when the FACI command is issued and the command is accepted.
The Programming time, Erasure time, and Blank check time are the time from when command processing starts to when it ends.
This does not include the time required for software processing before the command is accepted.
[Products that use software commands to control flash memory]
When a software command (81h(Program) etc.) is set in the FCR register, command processing begins.
The Programming time, Erasure time, and Blank check time are the time from when the software command is set to when command processing ends.
This does not include the software processing time required to set the software command in the FCR register.
Suitable Products
RX Family
